Articles.Content:
I love the newcarm pack but im noticing more bugs than I ever did before. I had a ship explode, kraken style, even though it was a new ship to my save. Ive had asteroids disappear while I was closing in within 1km. I had an old (pre arm update) ship blow itself apart at launch and then at a second try at launch the engine stopped for no reason and I couldnt do any control at all.

My game is totally unmodded and the lost control ship had plenty of power and resoyrces.

any thoughts? Is this only happening because its an old save I reloaded with the arm pack?
It sounds like corruption in the download. Run the Patcher to make sure you have the latest stuff (You may also need to run the launcher if you don't have the patcher)
I have had zero crashes, and have used all the new stuff repeatedly.

I haven't experienced anything like this with the new ARM update. Do you use a lot of mods? I was experiencing random crashes because I had installed too many memory intensive mods, it was quite frustrating so I disabled one or two of the big ones and ksp runs smooth without problems. You should probably try disabling all of your mods and trying the game without, then start adding them and see how it plays. Good luck figuring it out, hope it gets sorted soon.
I've experienced some bugs. I've had a ship in Kerbin orbit all of a sudden end up in Solar orbit. I've also had the game crash when I decouple the new large decoupler. No mods used on my end.
No mods on my system. I suspect it's a bad download. Every time I run the patcher it stops at 94% telling me it's all fine, but still the bugs...

All the mods on my system still work as they did before the patch (except Mechjeb, though I haven't bothered looking for an update yet).

The only thing I've noticed with performance is the game seems to crash a bit more. It's that darned 32bit OS I'm still using, running out of RAM, methinks.
